Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating Hillary Clinton's exoneration by stating that she was "completely exonerated" when there were ongoing investigations and questions surrounding the Whitewater scandal.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to prove that Hillary Clinton was completely exonerated in the official inquiry on Whitewater.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the official inquiry on Whitewater resulted in Hillary Clinton's complete exoneration, which may be a problematic assumption considering the complexities and controversies surrounding the scandal.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or interpretations of the findings of the official inquiry on Whitewater that contradict the claim of Hillary Clinton's complete exoneration.
